result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amber D Poulos

records.addlTxt: by DHS
Status conference on December 1, 2022 at 08:45 am.

4:16 PM Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 4:16 p.m.
INCLUDES: 21CM684, 22CM394.
State appears by ADA Alex Lech in person. Defendant appears in person, with Atty Julianne Lennon.
Date and time set for a competency hearing.
VRCW. 

Parties in receipt of competency report.
Atty Lennon was under the impression that the interview would have been done in person, but it was completed via phone.
ADA Lech does not think in-patient would be appropriate, but is in agreement to have an in-person report complete. 
COURT agrees with parties that an evaluation should be held in person.
Parties discuss evaluators that can conduct in-person interviews.
COURT orders WI Forensic Unit to complete another competency evaluation, if it does not work, the COURT will have to take into consideration an in-patient evaluation.
COURT open to parties suggesting a different evaluator, parties to file brief for the COURT's review.


DATES:
STC: 12/1/22 @ 8:45 a.m. 

Adjourned: 4:29 p.m.
Examining psychologist's report- Jenna Goebel, Psy.D.

Deft checks in with JA; Atty Lennon appears; Evaluation cannot be completed via phone; Atty Lennon made arrangements with library; Deft to complete evaluation at library and was given printed instructions by Atty Lennon

Status conference on September 26, 2022 at 02:55 pm.
Status hearing on October 18, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 11:33 a.m. 
INCLUDES: 21CM684, 22CM394.
State appears by ADA Alex Lech in person. Defendant appears in person with Atty Julianne Lennon.
VRCW. 

COURT notes the competency evaluation has not been complete yet as the Forensic Unit has not been able to contact the Defendant. 
Atty Lennon indicates her client is homeless and does not have a phone, was given a date by the Forensic Unit but was not given any zoom info.
COURT notes the deadline for the evaluation is approaching. 
ADA Lech requests the COURT to toll time limits, as he would like to see the evaluation.
Atty Lennon would not object to the COURT tolling time limits. 
COURT addresses parties.
COURT finds a stipulation of the parties to extend time limits 
Atty Lennon notes they will use the September 26th date for the evaluation.

DATES:
STC w/JA: 9/26/22 @ 2:55 p.m. 
STC: 10/18/22 @ 4:15 p.m.

Adjourned: 11:44 a.m.
by DHS

ADDRESS INFO for Amber D Poulos
Current: Homeless,   (Effective: 08-12-2022)
Prior: 613 Luebner St, Wausau, WI 54403 United States
Re: Order for Competency Examination by DHS
Status hearing on September 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 2:01 p.m. 
INCLUDES: 21CM684, 22CM394.
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett in person. Defendant appears in person, with Atty Julianne Lennon.
Date and time set for a motion re: competency exam.
VRCW. 

State has no objection to motion.
Atty Lennon requests the COURT to order a competency exam.
COURT orders competence evaluation to be done.

Atty Lennon to prepare order.

DATES:
STC: 9/20/22 @ 11:30 a.m.

Adjourned: 2:06 p.m.
Motion hearing on August 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for a Competency Examination of the Defendant
ADA Barnett appears; Atty Lennon appears; Deft excused; Future dates to be set at calendar call 08/02;

Public Safety Assessment Report

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 3:02 pm 
INCLUDES 22CM394 & 21CM684. 
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett; Defendant appears by Zoom Video from MCJ with Atty Peter Vu. 

**WARRANT QUASHED**

INITIAL APPEARANCE IN 22CM394. 
Reading Waived. Reserve Jurisdiction. 

PLEA: Not Guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: $1000 signature bond to cover both files - CONDITIONS:  
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances. 
- No possession of drug paraphernalia. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening. 

BRANCH 2 CASE. 
BFH: 5/10/2022 at 1:15 pm.
